attributes.comment:
I oppose the substantial increases proposed in USCIS 2006-0044 for immigration
documentation/services, in specific to adoption related requirements.

The cost of adoption is a relatively expensive process and could place an
additional financial burden on the average middle-class family, possibly making it
too prohibitive with these additional cost increase.

In many cases, due to the extended time lines of International Adoption, many
families must pay for the submission of new forms, the necessary evaluations and
biometric services, for the expired documents more than one time during the
adoption process.

The proposed increase of an average of sixty-six percent far exceeds any level of
inflation, salary or benefit increase for those who manage these documents.
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Lisa DeOms
